ground_truth_answer: In general arthroplasty, joint replacement can be either half-joint replacement (replacing one articulating surface with a metal prosthesis) or total replacement (both articulating surfaces replaced with components, typically one metal and one high-density polyethylene, held by acrylic cement). In TMJ replacement, there are also two options: partial joint replacement (replacing only one component - disc, ball, or socket) or total joint replacement (replacing both ball and joint with metal components that glide across each other).
